intro: Brathydium hyssopifolium, commonly known as the woolly hyssop, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and spikes of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with small, oval-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. The flowers bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
